lead_paragraph: A nun who has lived for 54 years under a vow of poverty became a millionaire today in the lottery, and pledged to use the money to support a retirement home. With members of the Sisters of St. Francis order cheering her on, Sister Josephine Contris, 71 years old, turned down a sure $40,000 to take a chance for the $1 million prize in the California lottery's Big Spin game.

headline.main: 'Lucky' Nun Wins $1 Million But Will Keep Vow of Poverty
